page.title: 16Farming in Low Lorton
page.content: The dairy herds are friesian except one large pedigree ayrshire herd. The beef are hereford, charolais or limousin. The hill fell sheep are swaledale ewes mated with swaledale or blueface leicester tips (rams) producing grey face lambs. Gimmer (female) and pure ram lambs are sold for breeding; wether (male) lambs for meat. A few farms breed grey face ewes with a suffolk tip for lambs suitable for the fat meat market. The nearest cattle market, Cockermouth, holds weekly auctions for the sale of fat stock, fortnightly sales for store cattle and special sales during the year for special stock or breeding animals.{FISH}- The river Cocker is fished purely for sport. The water board restocks annually with salmon and sea trout. There is also a small number of brown trout and eels.
